A: Read the following passage and answer the questions.Lily loved her small garden. Every morning, she would water her plants. Her favorite flower was a bright red rose. Bees often visited the rose, collecting nectar. In the evenings, Lily would sit on her porch, watching the sunset over her beautiful flowers. She felt happy and peaceful in her garden.
1. What did Lily do every morning? (a) read a book (b) water her plants (c) sing a song
2. What was Lily's favorite flower? (a) a daisy (b) a tulip (c) a red rose
3. What visited the rose? (a) butterflies (b) bees (c) birds
4. What did the bees collect from the rose? (a) pollen (b) water (c) nectar
5. Where did Lily sit in the evenings? (a) in the garden (b) on her porch (c) inside her house
6. What did Lily watch in the evenings? (a) the moon (b) the sunset (c) the stars
7. How did Lily feel in her garden? (a) sad (b) peaceful (c) tired
8. Was Lily's garden big or small? (a) big (b) very big (c) small
9. The dog barked _ (a) loudly (b) loud (c) louder
10. She _ (is/are) going to the park. (a) is (b) are (c) am
11. They _ (play/plays) soccer every Saturday. (a) play (b) plays (c) playing
12. He _ (run/runs) fast. (a) run (b) runs (c) running
13. My sister and I _ (love/loves) ice cream. (a) love (b) loves (c) loving
14. The book is _ (on/in) the table. (a) on (b) in (c) under
15. We went _ (to/too) the store. (a) to (b) too (c) two
16. The cat is _ (sleeping/sleeps) now. (a) sleeping (b) sleeps (c) slept
17. He _ (has/have) a new car. (a) has (b) have (c) having
18. This is _ (an/a) apple. (a) an (b) a (c) some
19. They _ (did not/do not) go to school yesterday. (a) did not (b) do not (c) does not
20. She sings _ (beautifully/beautiful). (a) beautifully (b) beautiful (c) beauty
21. What word means the same as 'big'? (a) small (b) large (c) tiny
22. What is the opposite of 'hot'? (a) warm (b) cold (c) burning
23. A word similar to 'quick' is _ (a) slow (b) fast (c) calm
24. The opposite of 'happy' is _ (a) joyful (b) sad (c) excited
25. Find a word that has a similar meaning to 'start'? (a) finish (b) begin (c) stop
26. What is the antonym of 'open'? (a) wide (b) closed (c) clear
27. A word similar to 'speak' is _ (a) listen (b) talk (c) hear
28. The opposite of 'up' is _ (a) over (b) down (c) in
29. What word means the same as 'gift'? (a) present (b) take (c) borrow
30. What is the opposite of 'day'? (a) morning (b) night (c) afternoon
31. By the time we arrived, they _ (had left/have left). (a) had left (b) have left (c) leaves
32. She said she _ (had finished/has finished) her homework. (a) had finished (b) has finished (c) finishes
33. He _ (had eaten/has eaten) breakfast before school. (a) had eaten (b) has eaten (c) eats
34. They _ (had seen/have seen) the movie many times. (a) had seen (b) have seen (c) see
35. I _ (had completed/have completed) the task before the deadline. (a) had completed (b) have completed (c) complete
36. The _ (red/redly) car drove past. (a) red (b) redly (c) reddest
37. She felt _ (happy/happily) about the news. (a) happy (b) happily (c) happiness
38. It was a _ (sunny/sunnily) day. (a) sunny (b) sunnily (c) sun
39. The _ (tall/tallest) tree in the forest was very old. (a) tall (b) tallest (c) taller
40. He wore a _ (blue/bluely) shirt. (a) blue (b) bluely (c) blueness

Read the story and choose the correct spelling for the underlined words.Yesterday, I went on a (41) _ (a) vacasion (b) vacation (c) vacashion to the beach. The weather was (42) _ (a) beutiful (b) beautiful (c) beautifull). I saw a big (43) _ (a) occean (b) ocean (c) oceen) and felt the warm (44) _ (a) sand (b) sannd (c) sanda) between my toes. I built a (45) _ (a) castel (b) castle (c) casle) and collected some pretty (46) _ (a) shels (b) shells (c) shellz). In the evening, we ate a delicious (47) _ (a) diner (b) dinner (c) dinnor). It was a (48) _ (a) wondeful (b) wonderfull (c) wonderful) day. I hope to go back (49) _ (a) soon (b) soone (c) suun) and (50) _ (a) enjoi (b) enjoy (c) enjooy) it again.
41. _ (a) vacasion (b) vacation (c) vacashion
42. _ (a) beutiful (b) beautiful (c) beautifull)
43. _ (a) occean (b) ocean (c) oceen)
44. _ (a) sand (b) sannd (c) sanda)
45. _ (a) castel (b) castle (c) casle)
46. _ (a) shels (b) shells (c) shellz)
47. _ (a) diner (b) dinner (c) dinnor)
48. _ (a) wondeful (b) wonderfull (c) wonderful)
49. _ (a) soon (b) soone (c) suun)
50. _ (a) enjoi (b) enjoy (c) enjooy)
B: Read the poem and answer the questions that follow.In meadows green, where daisies gleam,A gentle stream began to flow.A tiny fish, a silver dream,Swam gracefully, swift and low.The sun shone down, a golden light,Upon the water, clear and cool.A buzzing bee took happy flight,From flower to flower, a busy tool.The quiet breeze, a soft sigh,Made willow branches gently sway.
1. What color were the meadows described as? _________
2. What kind of fish was swimming in the stream? _________
3. What was shining down with a golden light? _________
4. Which creature was busy flying from flower to flower? _________
5. What did the quiet breeze cause to sway? _________
C: 1. What is the primary function of leaves on a plant?
2. Name one common type of natural disaster.
3. What is the purpose of traffic lights?
4. Identify a key component of a healthy diet.
5. What is the role of a librarian in a library?
answers_C: To control the flow of vehicles and pedestrians.
To help people find information and resources.
